body.subject: Implementation plan ready - Epic 28 God Agent Alfred
body.summary: plan.json emitted with 8 workstreams, 18 tasks (all <= 4h), test specs, CI gates, and rollback plans. Tasks sequenced: Domain & Contracts → Memory Fabric → Intent Routing & Planner → Skill Adapters → Consensus Bridge → Orchestrator → Presentation → Observability.
key_points: 8 workstreams: Domain & Contracts (3.5h), Memory Fabric (3h), Intent Routing & Planner (4h), Skill Adapters (8h), Consensus Bridge (3.5h), Orchestrator (4h), Presentation (3.5h), Observability (3h)
18 tasks total, all <= 4h: largest task is 3.5h (PlanCompilerService, GodAgentOrchestrator)

Skills are thin adapters wrapping existing use cases: ConciergeSkillAdapter → PersonalizedReplyUseCase, ResearchSkillAdapter → CompareRagAnswersUseCase, BuilderSkillAdapter → GenerateCodeUseCase, ReviewerSkillAdapter → ReviewHomeworkUseCase, OpsSkillAdapter → Prometheus + infra scripts
Test coverage targets: 75-90% per task, smoke tests for all 5 skills
CI gates: pytest, coverage, mypy, Black, layer boundary validation, performance targets
Rollback: revert commits, no data migration needed (skills are stateless wrappers, domain entities are pure Python)
concerns: Skill adapters MUST call existing use cases through application layer (no infrastructure bypass) - architecture validation in code review
PlanCompilerService must respect 2500 token budget from role prompts
MemoryFabricService must compress when >50 events, keep 20 after compression
ConsensusBridge timeout after 5 minutes, async queue required
Performance targets: < 150ms memory retrieval, < 5s intent routing, < 30s multi-step flows
body.action_needed: Read plan.json and start implementation. Begin with ws1 (Domain & Contracts) as it has no dependencies. Each task includes test_spec, ci_gates, rollback plan, and acceptance_criteria. Ensure test coverage >= 0.75-0.9 per task. Reuse existing test fixtures for skill adapters.
